intro: Encelia pleistocephala, commonly known as the woolly globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, white to grayish woolly foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms and specialized structures. Encelia pleistocephala is adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
